entry.title: GSOC 2015: MyOIS
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Marc Sol Farr, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain

MyOIS


Project description


What is MyoIS ?


MyoIS is a project that provides a new concept for controlling the Interactive Spaces platform, the manageable myo gadget will interpret predefined gestures.

Functionalities

  • New predefined gestures axes X , Y and Z.
  • Link to a practical demo with leds and a Raspberry Pi.
  • Link to a Liquid Galaxy if available (on custom IS/LG Software from End Point)


Linked technologies
  • Interactive Spaces
  • Myo
  • Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy
  • Liquid Galaxy
  • Google Earth


Values for Interactive Spaces community


A new input control of the IS platform

Annex

Myo motion control and gesture control armband bracelet uses arm muscle activity and EMG signals to control digital devices over Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy.
More info here.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: VYD Open Data
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Marc Sol Farr, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain
VYD Open Data

Project description


What is View Your Data?


View Your Data is a project ideated jointly by me and Andreu Ibez, mentor at GSOC Google Liquid Galaxy project, a project with 4 years in the GSOC.

The aim of the project is to create a tool that imports data of BigData platforms, and based on them create any presentation data layer to display in the Liquid Galaxy.
We want to choose for the GSoC as a pilot the  FiWare platform, the most used in Europe, and with many different data, that we pretend to add as layers on Liquid Galaxy.

Why VYD?


Nowadays, the Open Data movement is gaining in strength and we have much variety of data that can be imported in the Liquid Galaxy.

But in order to create a layer for each of this data we find the following difficulties:

  • File format (XML, CSV, JSON, etc ...)
  • Standard data format.
  • Presentation model.

The purpose of VYD is to resolve these difficulties and speed up the import process, representation and management layers.


How?


The project is divided into two modules:
  • Layer Generator
    • Parser Manager
      • Its responsibility is to download the file, parse it and convert it to JSON
    • Presentation Manager
      • Its responsibility is to display the data in JSON and the available presentation models, in order for the user to select the data and match them with the presentation models.
  • Layer Manager
      • Manager store, display, delete and refresh the layers of liquid Galaxy.



Layer Manager prototype

Web application where you can select the layers for load in liquid galaxy.



Linked technologies

Liquid Galaxy
Google Earth
FiWare and other Open Data platforms




Values for Liquid Galaxy community


A scalable and modular motor, that generates layers according the data selected online and put the layers into the liquid galaxy.

Annex


Fiware seeks to provide a truly open, public and royalty-free architecture and a set of open specifications that will allow developers, service providers, enterprises and other organizations to develop products that satisfy their needs while still being open and innovative.

One of the parts of this project is FIWARE Lab Data Portal, a data hub for Smart Cities and organizations to offer Data to be used by developers and entrepreneurs for experimentation.


Clarification
This project has another approach to the one that Joan Llimiana, GSOC 2013 Liquid Galaxy LAB student, has.
Well be doing it server side, with different languages such as bash, python, HTML5, Javascript and CSS. It will be not an Android application.
We will be reviewing the code and approach executed by Joan, but with the idea of a bigger reach, as I see the project do not achieve a great results.

In summary VYD will be hosted on a machine outside the Liquid Galaxy, the reason are to create an add on to liquid galaxy.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: Liquid Galaxy Android POI controller
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Rafael Duran Saez, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Lleida, Spain
Liquid Galaxy Android POI controller

Project description
The main aim of this project is to create a fluid Android apk controller for the Liquid Galaxy. This user interface will have three main sections:
  • POIs and TOURs selector: it will let the user to select the POIs or TOURs where the Liquid Galaxy will travel and, of course, the user will be able to watch it in the LG monitors.
  • Search, by on screen keyboard and voice, will be implemented.
  • Management tool: this option will let admin users create, edit and delete POIs and TOURs through a pin protected administration area. This tool will also let the admin run some scripts to manage the Liquid Galaxy, such as shut down the rig, reset the X, reset the Earth client, and launch other new applications and demos, HTML5 Peruse-a-rue, the new CMS IS based LG by End Point corp, etc

POIs view with nested items

TOURs view

The apk will be a fluid version, resizable automatically, for tablets and smartphones.

An extra function that will might also be developed will consists in dividing the main POIs and TOURs user interface into two parts: one part would contain these elements I have just mentioned and the other part would contain a Map (from Google Maps). This functionality will let the user indicate the place where the Liquid Galaxy has to travel just by touching the screen. If Peruse-A-Rue is installed well be linking that to Street View.
POIs view with nested items


Linked technologies
Android, Liquid Galaxy, bash, SSH, ADA Framework (database link)


Values for Liquid Galaxy community
Replace the current web based interface for POIs, that has no functionality for editing them, arrange as TOURs and easy access to admin scripts.
Use broadly available Android tablet. Also cheaper and with better touch response than current touch screens. Multitouch capabilities to be explored.
An added value will be an online available text and graphics manual where Ill explain the process of capturing POIs from Google Earth, and to enter them on the apk.

link.title: GSOC 2015: Liquid Galaxy Android POI controller

entry.title: GSOC 2015: Wikipedia Liquid Galaxy Mashup
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Rafael Duran Saez, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Lleida, Spain

Wikipedia Liquid Galaxy Mashup

Preliminary
This proposal is a fruit from cross pollination between GSoC project. Back in 2013 some mentors and students of the Liquid Galaxy project visited Wikimedia offices in San Francisco, meeting Quim Gil, Project Manager, Wikimedia Foundation GSoC responsible and old friend of Andreu Ibanez, my mentor in my career final project.
They talked about the possibility of doing this project using Wikimedia backend.
Andreu, Quim, Ismael and Joan at Wikimedia San Francisco Offices.

Quim explained them that all 14+millions of wikidata articles can be accessed with the API to Wikidata. Wikidata is a free linked database that can be read and edited by both humans and machines.
And as they say, all data is Free. The data in Wikidata is published under the Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication 1.0 https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Main_Page

They have all Wikipedia articles and some other data such as pictures and media of the day
seen in https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Main_Page


Project description

The main aim of this project is to create a link to Wikimedia backend and the Liquid Galaxy.
The link will allow us to show on the LG monitors, for example, the location of the last uploaded article in Wikipedia and a bubble with its information.

To achieve this goal I plan to develop a fluid Android apk. The Android apk application will handle the connection with the API, transformation of the data and sending to the rig, through a SSH tunnel by wifi. No programming on the rig is needed.

It is also possible to get the Wikipedia data by using the DBpedia project and other tools for that Wikipedias data extraction.

My idea is to query the API with a time interval the user decides and sets, and show up the info on screens. The apk will have also a UI, where the rig user will be able to filter data by:
  • Country
  • Language
  • Timeline


Linked technologies

Android, SSH, JSON, XML, Lua, Wikimedia API.

Values for Liquid Galaxy community

  • A great informative tool for visitors
  • A screensaver like tool for having the liquid galaxies always doing stuff.
  • A cross pollination GSoC projects

entry.title: GSOC 2015: FAED Mesh
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Marc Gonzalez, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain
FAED Mesh Interactive Spaces

Project description
  • The main idea of this project is to use a drone to bring flying an automated electronic defibrillator (AED) where a cardiac emergency is happening. This drone will have a support platform with an easy extraction system in order to get the AED as fast as possible.

  • As a part of the global project called FAED, my project goal will consist to use the Interactive Spaces software to develop a platform that allows the reception of data, parsing into different formats and finally be used by the Liquid Galaxy to show the information in the system.

  • It seems necessary to have a flexible, powerful and scalable system that allows to communicate with drones, weather stations and a local system. For this, IS seems a possibility software to deploy it because it uses de ROS platform to communicate different kinds of systems. We know that actually it is easy to communicate IS with LG, but we should investigate to communicate this with drones or outside elements.

  • A more extended document is available will all the ideas and partners about project FAED. Moreover it includes the different elements that interfere in the project and introducing a first nomenclature approach.


  • In the next image you should be able to see the different sources where the IS framework will work as a man in the middle of all the project. Using IS I pretend to communicate with all the the different actors in the project and enables a complete and secure communication between all of them.



Linked technologies
  • In order to deploy the present project will be need to use different kind of technologies and know how they work, it happens because the data parsing is the process in the middle to communicate both platforms. A possible list of software needed will be:
    • Interactive Spaces
    • Liquid Galaxy
    • Physical Web
    • Mission Planner
    • ArduPilot
    • Mavros

Values for Liquid Galaxy community

  • It can a real good use case, and it will be a great opportunity to show the goodness of this platform for the public in general.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: Geography Quiz
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Marc Gonzalez, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain
Geography Quiz


Project description

The main idea of this project is to develop a real use case like a game to be used in the Liquid Galaxy platform. Could be possible to create a geography quiz game to be used in the primary or high schools, and also in all liquid galaxy around the world with schools or general visits.

In the Galaxy rig will appear a city, but too close (just enough close to be difficult to detect the correct city) to the point of view, at the same time in the touchscreen panel will appear the
different options with the names of possibly cities that the user must choose with a time bar.

In the following images should be possible to view and approach way to show the information in the touchscreen. In the image 1 will see the different games that the user can choose to play, maybe some configuration settings should be able to be displayed to the user or a ranking with the high scores.


Should be interesting to developed this platform with modules, giving to the manager the possibility to add new features, new games, change the questions, etc.

Image1. Touchscreen Menu


The main idea of the detail view will be to show as better as possible the different elements that appear in a game, like the number of actual question and total, the score, the different options to choose, a timebar, etc

Image2. Detail Game



Meanwhile the time is running out, the image in the galaxy rig will be moving away to give to the user more information about the country. At the same time, if the user leaves too much time to answer the question he/she will win less points.

The full playability will be elaborated if I go for GSoC.

To develop this project should be great to present it inside the CS4HS Google program but the deadline is on 20th February so it will be impossible to sign in inside the program. Anyway, maybe next year should be possible to sign in.

Also will be develop a tool to create all the content, like managing the different questions, games, typologies, etc.


Linked technologies

To develop this project I propose to use the basic web languages to develop the interface that will be used to interact with the galaxy system.

On the other hand, to develop the communication with the galaxy could be possible to use the Interactive Spaces activities that I developed in my last project the last year.

Im wondering if should be possible to use DART or Polymer language because that seems a good language to develop web apps.

Possible languages:
  • HTML5
  • PHP
  • CSS3
  • Javascript
  • DART? Polymer?
  • Interactive Spaces?
  • ??


Values for Liquid Galaxy community

  • The creation of a game based to be used in a LG system. That can be used in every Liquid Galaxy, maybe focused in education places or museums.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: FAED Visualization
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Julio Bondia, Universitat Rovira i Virgili (URV) student, Spain

FAED Visualization
Preliminary

The main idea of FAED project is to use a drone to bring flying an automated electronic defibrillator (AED) where a cardiac emergency is happening. This drone will have a support platform with an easy extraction system in order to get the AED as fast as possible.

Liquid Galaxy technology use abstract: FAED Display will be a software engine that connects to data sources, converting and handle them accordingly, and displays them in the Liquid Galaxy. Data will be of many kinds, shapes, numbers, positions, etc
Observation: I do not need the other colleague from Interactive Spaces data to make my project, more on this later. If Im alone in this Ill program emulators for all the needed data.
Project Description

As a part of the global project FAED, my project goal will consist on getting all the data from the FAED Mesh and display it on the Liquid Galaxy.


  • The FAED Mesh will be a Interactive Spaces server that will get the data from many sources.


So the main idea here is to build and display the different layers in the mentioned system, which could be: drone movement, drone hangars (POIs) and its area of influence, drone points of landing, meteorology information, meteorology stations (POIs) etc.


Whats more, every drone will carry a Physical Web beacon which will be advertising an URL with the drone identifier. Once someone gets this URL, can see all the information related to this drone: where it comes from, where it is going, what emergency is giving support to, etc. This is a requirement from the law, to have any flying drone fully identified.

Linked Technologies

In order to deploy the present project will be needed to use different kind of technologies and know how they work, it happens because the data parsing is the process in the middle to communicate both platforms. A possible list of technologies needed will be:

  • Deep knowledge in Liquid Galaxy, Interactive Spaces, and Google Earth platform generally.

  • Good grasp of Java/Python to get and format the received data to be represented in the Liquid Galaxy.

  • HTML5, Django/Grails (open source!) for the Physical Web websites, linked to an external.


Values for Liquid Galaxy community

  • The project will interact with other Google technologies such as Interactive Spaces and Physical Web.

  • As a real good use case it seems a great opportunity to show the goodness of this platform. Liquid Galaxy will have

entry.title: GSOC 2015: BYOP
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Julio Bondia, Universitat Rovira i Virgili (URV) student, Spain

BYOP (Bring Your Own POIS).
Project Description

Liquid Galaxy represents the POIS the user determines, as well as tours, etc. The main idea of my proposal is to allow users to deploy their favourite POIS in the Liquid Galaxy through a wireless technology such as Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

With the collaboration of Google Physical Web project, that has offered us free hardware for testing, Ill be using an Intel Edison to implement a BLE scanner in order to scan the advertising BLE devices in the area. The users are supposed to bring a Physical Web beacon, which will be continuously advertising a website, where the user favourite POIs will be available.

Once the scanner has found this Physical Web (PW) beacon it will interact with the Liquid Galaxy to make it know there is someone who wants to deploy its POIs, so the Liquid Galaxy will wait for confirmation. Ill add some hardware to the Edison platform, such as a simple button, to confirm the action (for security reason). A green led will light to know that POIs have been received and a refresh to the user interface is needed.



Once the action is confirmed the POIs will be deployed in the Liquid Galaxy and the user will be able to see them in the screens. Thats why I called the project BYOP.

In order to build the user POIs set, I will develop an Android tool where the user can define its own POIs. This information will be stored in the user Google Drive account and the URL to the uploaded file will be the one the Physical Web beacon will advertise. The POIs set will be stored in the actual standard POIs XML file in a Liquid Galaxy. Next to the app the users will have a manual explaining the process of capturing POIs from Google Earth in large sets.

So when the scanner detects the Physical Web beacon and confirms the action, the system will connect to this URL and will download the POIs stored/selected in it.

Another button will be added for a restoration of the previous POIs after a visit.


Some special questions

The Museum or whatever place that has the Liquid Galaxy, will be promoting this new functionality, pointing to the Play Store URL for downloading the app, that will include embedded the manual.

How they will have a PW beacon?
  • In the very near future the app will act as a beacon, and well implement this functionality on the app.
  • The museum can have some in stock and give or sell away
  • On the info page the museum can link to a PW beacons seller web.


Use Case
  • Previous to a visit to a Liquid Galaxy
    • The teacher will use the app to elaborate his POI set and bring the PW beacon to the visit.
  • At the Liquid Galaxy
    • The teacher will be broadcasting his BLE signal.
    • Edison hardware will receive it, test its been well formatted, and light the green led.
    • The museum or the like personnel will have to press the go button, and POIs will be upgraded.
    • A refresh to the LG web page is needed.
    • And voil, the new POIs appear.
  • After a visit:
    • The museum personnel will restart the previous/default POIs, just touching another button on the Edison board.


Linked Technologies

In order to deploy the present project will be needed to use different kind of technologies and know how they work, it happens because the data parsing is the process in the middle to communicate both platforms. A possible list of technologies needed will be:

  • Intel Edison hardware.

  • Deep knowledge on Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

  • Good grasp of Java/Python to implement the BLE scanner, get the POIS from the advertised website and send them to the Liquid Galaxy over SSH/Wifi with the right data format.

  • Regular expressions (regex) to test the right format of the user created POIs.

  • Android for the POIs creation and managing tool.


Values for Liquid Galaxy community

  • Planning visits to a Liquid Galaxy rig. In the installations around the world in museums and aquariums, a little explanation of this tool will offer the possibility to visiting teachers, schools, and others, deploy his own POIs.
  • Have an Android App with a great utility to build community around the LG.
  • Another useful scenario will be a Liquid Galaxy having in stock several beacons with several POIs sets, and uploading them upon the kind of visit or activity.
  • This project will allow some customization focused on the user preferences and needs. The first step is to deploy POIS, but surely more features can be added through this way of communication.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: JS Space Nav
entry.content:
JS Space Nav - GSOC 2015 project proposal
Ismael Arroyo, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain


Project description

Implement the Space Navigator controller for Javascript to allow it to be used on web applications like CesiumJS or WebGL applications.

entry.title: GSOC 2015: Cardboard-VR/MYO
entry.content:
GSOC 2015 project proposal
Ismael Arroyo, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain
Cardboard-VR/MYO

Project description
My project would be mixing Liquid Galaxy with VR technologies like Cardboard (https://www.google.com/get/cardboard/) to add a true immersive environment and a synergic interaction controller.



The main issue when showing LG to people is the training time of the peripheral (SpaceNav, Leapmotion, etc). To overpass this, a more intuitive peripheral like Myo (https://www.thalmic.com/en/myo/)  can be added to the system.
Myo and Cardboard would be additional controllers for a Liquid Galaxy system on which a user can immerse totally in a photosphere, Street View (Peruse-A-Rue) or other different use cases where 360 visualization is required.
The project would consist on synchronize the Cardboard view with the Liquid Galaxys view and, also, add a new controller like Myo.

There can be a new button in the touchscreen or tablet interface to enable and disable these features to choose what controller is in use.


Value added for the Liquid Galaxy project
This project will share the personal experience of using a LG with visiting colleagues by using the 2015 emerging technology of virtual reality (cardboard, oculus rift, etc).
One person will use the VR headset while others can share the same experience with LG together.


Linked technologies
Google Cardboard SDK (https://developers.google.com/cardboard/android/get-started)
Myo SDK (https://developer.thalmic.com/docs/api_reference/platform/the-sdk.html)

entry.title: GSOC 2015: MyoGalaxy
entry.content:

Marc Sol Farr, Liquid Galaxy LAB, Spain

MyoGalaxy

What is MyoGalaxy ?



MyoGalaxy is a project that provides a new concept for controlling the liquid galaxy, and through the manageable galaxy the myo gadget will interpret predefined gestures.

entry.title: El Proyecto FAED en el #internationaldroneday gracias a @gigabytespain @BenQ_Spain y @EPS_UDL
entry.content:
Con la colaboracin de Gigabyte y BENQ, el nuevo Moving Liquid Galaxy FAED estuvo presente en el International Drone Day, evento mundial realizado simultneamente en ms de 150 localizaciones de 40 pases, donde se buscaba remarcar todas las bondades de los Drone, aplicadas a campos como la agricultura, atencin sanitaria, extincin de incendios, etc.

Para eso el equipo de estudiantes de la Escuela Politcnica Superior de la Universidad de Lleida residentes en el Liquid Galaxy LAB del Parc Cientfic de Lleida se pusieron manos a la obra con los nuevos y brillantes equipamientos cedidos para el proyecto FAED por las marcas Gigabyte (gracias Noelia y Colin) y BENQ (gracias Silvia).




Recordemos que el proyecto FAED consiste en el diseo de una plataforma software y hardware por el cual unos Drones preparados adecuadamente puedan llevar un desfibrilador (AED, F de Flying) volando al lugar donde acontezca una crsis cardaca.
El papel de las plataformas de Google Liquid Galaxy e Interactive Spaces en el proyecto es doble, por un lado servir de sistema de visualizacin, donde se pueden tener controlados los hangares de los drones, sus zonas de influencia, y sensores de todo tipo, hasta enviar las rdenes de destino a los drone en el caso de ser lanzado para una emergencia, mostrando el desplazamiento en tiempo real.

Aqu un vdeo resumen de la prueba de concepto realizada por Lleida Drone en sus III Conferencias, Julio 2013:




Para ms informacin del proyecto mirad en Lleida Drone.




Algunos impactos en prensa y fotografias reflejaron el inters de los centenares de visitantes de toda Espaa al evento, haciendo cola para manejar el equipo MLG FAED

En portada, interior y contraportada el diario Segre de Lleida:









- Programa en COPE Lleida con Neosalus Solutions  para hablar del proyecto FAED y el International Drone Day.

entry.content:

Lleida Drone conjuntamente con los compaeros del grupo de Facebook RC/Drone/VANT Catalunya , liderados por el Natxo Varona, vamos a realizar un evento para celebrar el
International Drone Day.
Ms de 30 pases y 120 entidades nos sumamos a este da para lanzar un mensaje claro al mundo:
que los drones no estan para hacer dao, espiar o causar ningn problema, al contrario, han de ser usados con buenos fines como la fotografa, la bsqueda y rescate, apagar fuegos, o como divertimiento.

Para ello organizamos el siguiente evento dentro de la actividad mundial:
http://www.internationaldroneday.com/

Y celebrando el dcimo aniversario del Parc Cientfic de Lleida




Y un vdeo resumen de los 6 anteriores eventos organizados por Lleida Drone

09:30 Bienvenida con multimedia espectacular vdeo+lser.

         El proyecto FAED iniciado por nuestro equipo ya va a hacer 3 aos, est siendo objeto

entry.title: Estamos dentro del GSoC 2015 con los proyectos Liquid Galaxy y Interactive Spaces un poquito de datos
entry.content:
Tras un esfuerzo de meses, tejiendo redes de contactos, consiguiendo nuevos partners y manteniendo los actuales, trabajando los proyectos con los posibles futuros becarios, es para mi un honor anunciar que Google nos ha aprobado la presentacin de los proyectos mster y de nuevo estar en el GSoC con el Liquid Galaxy y esta vez tambien con el Interactive Spaces.


Pero esto an es el primer paso, en breves das hemos de presentar las propuestas de los estudiantes del Liquid Galaxy LAB a Google, iniciando una larga ronda de entrevistas con muchos mentores que viven por todo el mundo. Hangouts realizados siempre a horas muy variadas e incluso en la madrugada, serviran para entrevistar a los centenares de propuestas que alumnos de todo el mundo nos enviarn.


Para los que estis interesados os dar unos datos, extrados de mis charlas sobre el GSoC que acabo de dar para Alemania y en Madrid

- En el 2013 se presentaron 5.999 propuestas de estudiantes por 4.151 estudiantes (s, se puede presentar ms de una con un mximo, creo recordar, de 3) de 94 pases.
Las 177 organizaciones mentoras (proyectos generales) despus de un rduo trabajo escogimos 1.192 estudiantes de 70 pases.

- En el 2014, dcimo aniversario del GSoC, se aceptaron 1307 estudiantes de 72 pases, 190 Organizaciones Open Source que tenan en sus filas a 2491 mentores.
El 89.7% Alumnos que acabaron su beca.En Espaa tuvimos 32 alumnos (a la baja :(  despus de 35 en 2013)

- En este 2015 Google ha hecho una criba, con lo cual tiene mucha ms relevancia haber conseguido no uno si no dos proyectos: despus de recibir 416 propuestas de organizaciones, han escogido 137, 37 de las cuales son nuevas.

entry.title: Resumen final y agradecimientos de la Expo Joan Or 2014 de #lleida
entry.content:
La exposicin Any Or 2014 ha tenido lugar en Lleida ciudad entre los meses de octubre del 2014 y enero del 2015. Realizada en un entorno muy especial, los restos de las primeras casa romanas de Lleida datadas el ao 2 despus de Cristo, la exposicin ha tenido una gran acogida en la ciudad, con ms de 3.000 visitantes, entre los que se pueden contar decenas de escuelas y todo tipo de visitantes.




El Dr. Joan Or nacido en Lleida en el ao 1923, fu un ilustre y reconocido cientfico especializado en el origen de la vida, que tuvo su punto lgido en los 30 aos de trabajo para la NASA en Houston. All tuvo la ocasin de trabajar directamente en los proyectos Apollo y Viking, as como estudiar abundantes muestras de meteoritos cados por toda la tierra.


Adems la exposicin ha sido el marco para la realizacin de diversos otros actos, como concursos de experimentos escolares, visitas guiadas para agrupaciones, y otros ms.



La exposicin estuvo basada en 3 tipos de contenidos:


1.- Los ms biogrficos basados en 17 paneles que impresos a todo color con un diseo muy impactante explicaban a travs de una lnea de tiempo las diferentes etapas de la vida del Dr. Or.



2.- La siguiente parte de la exposicin estaba dotada de contenidos ms multimedia e interactivos, donde los visitantes podan ver, or, e interactuar con diferentes elementos tecnolgicos aportados por diferentes entidades:



Panel de recepcin a la Expo con los logos de los partners.


  • Proyeccin Lser color, con la colaboracin de Gigabyte Spain.
    Gigabyte Spain cedi los mini pcs BRIX que permitieron realizar la programacin y exposicin de los espectculos lser a diario.






  • Moving Liquid Galaxy I, cedido por el Liquid Galaxy LAB, con la colaboracin de Gigabyte Spain.
    EL MLG 1 es un clster compuesto por 3 ordenadores de mxima gama (I7, 16 GB RAM, SSD, placa madre Gigabyte) que permita la navegacin interactiva por un compendio de arecifes coralinos que Google tiene fotografiados en 360 grados, estilo Street View, pero submarinos.



  • Lleida Liquid Galaxy, cedido por el Parque Cientfico de Lleida.
    EL Lleida Liquid Galaxy es la versin de mayor tamao de Liquid Galaxy de que disponemos: al completo pesa ms de una tonelada y dispone de 8 pantallas de 55 colocadas de forma que el visitante tiene una visin totalmente inmersiva.


  • Vdeo proyeccin de los proyectos Apollo, Viking y la misin Rosseta, con la colaboracin de Gigabyte Spain y la NASA.

    Un auditorio presentaba una vdeo proyeccin con contenidos especiales cedidos por la NASA y proyectados desde un BRIX de Gigabyte.





  • Ordenadores tctiles cedidos por HP Espaa con aplicaciones interactivas cedidas por la NASA.
    Donde los varios miles de alumnos que visitaron la exposicin tuvieron la oportunidad de usar con aplicaciones especialmente cedidas desde las instalaciones de la NASA en Houston, como por ejemplo las partes de la Estacin Espacial Internacional. Los ordenadores cedidos por HP Espaa eran la perfecta plataforma por su gran formato y pantalla tctil para que los chavales pudieran jugar y aprender.


  • Dome de proyeccin esfrica cedida La Caixa.
    La Fundacin La Caixa cedi uno de sus dome con proyeccin esfrica donde los visitantes se sumergan en una visin de microscopio atmico sobre microorganismos.



3.- Y ya la ltima parte era el Diorama.
Este era una escena encuadrada en los restos romanos, donde se ubicaron ms de 100 objetos reales propiedad de la Fundacin Joan Or, y que acompaaron la vida del Dr. Or.
Entre ellos se podan ver diferentes planos originales de la NASA, condecoraciones y reconocimientos diversos, y sobre todo una exposicin de ms de 20 restos de meteoritos reales en los cuales el Dr. Or haba trabajado en la bsqueda de los componentes de la vida.

entry.title: De visitas por Liquid Galaxys y otros sistema multipantalla en California, con el Galactic Team #liquidgalaxy
entry.content:
El pasado octubre tuvimos la oportunidad de ir de nuevo a Google para la reunin anual de los mentores del GSOC, este ao incluyendo alumnos. Y puestos a aprovechar el viaje visitamos toda una serie de instalaciones de Liquid Galaxy por la costa californiana junto a los compaeros Andrew de la Universidad de Western Sidney y Ben de End Point Corp. Andreu y Marc fuimos los representantes espaoles :)

Empezamos en Los ngeles, en CBRE, 2a empresa Immobiliaria de USA, y donde el caso de uso a nivel negocios es el mejor gracias al gestor de contenido desarrollado para tal efecto.










Cerca de la ciudad estuvismo en el Galaxy del Acuario de Los ngeles, llamado Aquarium of the Pacific http://www.aquariumofpacific.org/ el cual est rodeada de impresionantes instalaciones con peceras de todo tipo y unas actividades educativas que solo los americanos son capaces de hacer.



(ms fotos pendientes)


Ya en la Bahia de Monterey, en Santa Cruz cerca del Silicon Valley, visitamos el National Marine Sanctuary .








Durante la cena de celebracin del dcimo aniverario del GSOC que se realiz en el Tech Museum Center de San Jos, corazn del Silicon Valley, tuvimos la ocasin de demostrar el sistema a algunos de los 600 compaeros tutores y alumnos que nos encontramos all.







Y por supuesto y como siempre, visitamos algunos de los muchos Galaxys que hay instalados en el Google Plex:


Otras visitas ya no de Liquid Galaxy y si de otros sistemas multipantalla la hicimos en las Espectaculares instalaciones de realidad virtual de Calit2, en la Universidad de California en SanDiego.



A travs de diferentes contactos cerramos una visita con el amigo Jurgen Schulze y en la cual tuvimos ocasin de ver e interactuar con sus instalaciones similares en cierta medida a nuestro Liquid Galaxy, aunque estas clramente orientadas a la realidad virtual, necesitndose gafas 3D y sistemas de posicionamiento espacial.

 Con Ben y Marc

Las tripas: el clster de detrs, con un pc cada dos monitores.




Botando el sistema cncavo.

En accin.








Y como un Youtube vale ms que 100.000 de mis simples palabras, aqu os dejamos mltiples vdeos de sus hasta 4 instalaciones que con un coste enorme, denota la apuesta por la investigacin por la UC.

En este primer video podis ver un paseo interactivo en una instalacin tipo CAVE, en forma casi esfrica, mientras hacemos un recorrido por una instalacin de ingeniera.




Aqu podis ver como bota el sistema, con la configuracin de las pantallas
y el men interactivo del sistema:




Aqu podis ver una aplicacin estrella, con la cual representan datos de excavaciones arqueolgicas geolocalizadas y en mltiples layers, aunque realmente lo que vemos es el men interactivo en marcha:




Esta otra instalacin en formato menos immersivo est ideada para representar y navegar a travs de imgenes Gigapan como primer caso de uso:




Y aqu tenemos otro factor de forma, con usos similares pero ms potencia:

link.title: De visitas por Liquid Galaxys y otros sistema multipantalla en California, con el Galactic Team #liquidgalaxy

entry.title: #Google Summer of Code #GSOC2014 presentation at the @RITSI national congress in Crdoba #gdg #event
entry.content:
Next 28th march Andreu will be giving a presentation about the Google Summer of Code program, similar to the one given in Bucarest, Rumania.


The event will be the V Congreso Estatal RITSI, en Crdoba, with a preliminary 2.000+ attendance.


In this speech Andreu will explain the virtues and statistics of the GSOC program, and also the Lleida based experience with the Liquid Galaxy project, that has been for 4 years in the GSOC, partnering with End Point Corp. New York and University Western Sidney, Australia.

Lleida's Liquid Galaxy LAB it's a 60 square meter laboratory for students in his end of career projects, PhD thesis and GSOC projects, all focused in Liquid Galaxy and other Google technologies.


Also in a booth for GDG Spain, we'll be explaining to other interested parties about the Google Developers Group.

Graciously provided by OSPO managers from Google, also we'll have some swag to give away among the presentation atendees, pencils, t-shirts and nice adhesives will show up:


Offer from Liquid Galaxy LAB to the students:  (local sign in catalan that's been spread around Lleida's university)

entry.title: Interactive Spaces - Liquid Galaxy, Marc Gonzalez GSOC 2014 project
entry.content:
In this video Marc demoes us his briefly his development, basically a link between IS and LG using voice. This was the scope of his GSOC project, but it will shine when installed in october 2014 at an Exposition regarding live of Dr. Joan Or, a well known Biochemist born in Lleida.

The full project includes more advanced hardware integration with IS, as a proximity sensor to detect a near person that will open the mike for voice recognition, no on screen touch action required, and an Arduino board with some other add-ons. The hack will launch a pulse of laser light to a full Moon on the Liquid Galaxy Screen, pointing to the area (Point of Interest) that the user has requested and after that moving the screens to the point. This will allow for people visiting the expo know the general ubication of the place on the Moon surface.





Link to the original GSOC proposal

entry.title: El Moving Liquid Galaxy 2 prximamente en la Exposicin Any Or 2014 de Lleida
entry.content:
El Moving Liquid Galaxy 2 estar presente en la exposicin que el Ayuntamiento de Lleida organiza el prximo otoo para homenajear el reconocio cientfico Joan Or, que trabaj para la NASA durante 30 aos en Houston y fu un experto en el anlisis del posible origen de la vida en el espacio.

Aqui el Dr. Joan Or con un meteorito d elos muchos que analiz en busca de vida.

En este caso el MLG2 estar mostrando los contenidos de Google Oceans en la zona dedicada a la biologa, cercano al planetario movil de La Caixa, y dentro de un conjunto expositivo mucho ms amplio por el cual pasaran miles de escolares de unas 50 escuelas y unos 20.000 visitantes en general.



Los ocanos son la gran reserva de vida de la tierra, y estn siendo atacados, por eso el proyecto Google Oceans pretende mentalizar a la poblacin de su importancia.


La exposicin contar adems con la presentacin del proyecto interactivo becado por Google y realizado gracias a la colaboracin de nuestros partners:

entry.title: Vdeos
Prensa
Interactive Spaces, proyecto 2014, Marc Gonzalez
entry.content:
Marc Gonzalez trabajar su proyecto de final de mster con la plataforma Interactive Spaces de Google, en el cual enlazaremos el Liquid Galaxy en un proyecto de exposicin interactiva con la Luna cedida por la NASA de que disponemos en el Parc Cientfic de Lleida, aprovechando para promocionar el ao Or, con el que se pretende fomentar los estudios de ciencias.

Google Interactive Spaces on Liquid Galaxy to promote Science


In this project will use Google Interactive Spaces that are physical spaces with interactivity to display information on Liquid Galaxy.

The main idea is implament an activities that use a relay box or Arduino boards that connects to LG and show more information on it. We have though and specific case use to show their operation.


The idea is to mix a Liquid Galaxy, the mockup and a array of small laser diodes, all driven by IS software. A web menu on the touch screen will show a list of the 10 most important places on the moon (10 for ten laser), when the user pushes a place (point of interest in Liquid Galaxy/maps terminology) the Liquid Galaxy moves to that place, showing a popup with more info and allowing the visitor fly freely around, but also, and driven by IS, one of the laser diodes will light the place on the mockup.


Will use IS to connect all the events producers and events consumers and LG to display the information. We could try to use Google Earth or the new version of software Peruse-a-rue that we have installed on LAB running into Ubuntu and Windows systems.

entry.title: Benchmarking WEB, proyecto 2014 Ismael Arroyo
entry.content:
System, Network, and Performance Monitoring for Liquid Galaxy web-based applications
The main idea is to follow my GSOC 2013 project about benchmarking Liquid Galaxy while running Google Earth, but now focusing on a Client-Server architecture like Google Maps, Peruse-a-Rue or others.

This project would involve capturing performance values, like CPU, memory, networking and/or graphic performance, format the obtained data and visualize it.

In order to complete this task, I will reuse some of the code that I already have to analyze obtained data and plot graphics. The main work will be code the scripts that would capture the performance data, format it in a readable file or files to later show the graphics from the data. A web application will be developed to make it user-friendly.

An example of chart from my previous work that I will be reusing


The web-tool to benchmark Google Earth from GSOC 2013

entry.title: Hangouts WebRTC, proyecto 2014, Carlos de Dios
entry.content:
Hangouts WebRTC

In the LG LAB we think that involving conference calls and the LG project is a really good mix and would give a better and realistic way to communicate between people. Weve been studying the past year GSOC projects from Mihai and Randy, and we think it will be good to continue the project and try to improve the characteristics of it and make it more user friendly with a user interface and administrative layer.




It will be using WebRTC to enable the Real Time Communications on the browsers.

The awesomest aspect is that we dont need an LG to make a video conference with whoever, this program allows conferences between users without LG and supports multiple users with LG in the same conference.

I will be doing this project as my final degree project in the University de Lleida

link.title: Hangouts WebRTC, proyecto 2014, Carlos de Dios

entry.title: Proyecto LAB: PULGA (Portable USB Liquid GAlaxy)
entry.content:
The "PULGA, Portable USB Liquid GAlaxy" project is the 2013 End of Career project for the computing degree of Sergi Buitrago, a University of Lleida Engineering School (EPS) alumni.

It consist on a bootable USB based Linux distro for schools and telecentres to run a Liquid Galaxy in a snap at a cero cost.


The PULGA project will be developed together with several educational and administrative institutions, who will give us acces to his computer classrooms for analysis and testing, and will help us define the use cases as a teaching tool for the Liquid Galaxy in schools and computing training.

- Departament d'Ensenyament, Delegaci de Lleida.
- Institut Caparrella.
- IES Lladonosa.
- IES Mollerussa.

- Universitat de Lleida, Escola Politcnica Superior.

- Xarxa de Telecentres, Ajuntament de Lleida

- Parc Cientfic i Tecnolgic de Lleida

link.title: Proyecto LAB: PULGA (Portable USB Liquid GAlaxy)

entry.title: Proyecto LAB: Liquid Galaxy Benchmarking
entry.content:
The "Liquid Galaxy Benchmarking" project is part of the Doctoral Thesys  for the computing degree of Ismael Arroyo, a University of Lleida Engineering School (EPS) alumni.


It consist on several utilities that will analyze and compare the performance of the diferent pieces of hardware and software involved. The project will help all the other on the Liquid Galaxy LAB.


Ismael is developing a three year process for his doctoral thesys around many aspects of the Liquid Galaxy in the LAB.

entry.title: Proyecto LAB: Android controller and administration tool for Liquid Galaxy rigs.
entry.content:
The "Android controller and administration tool for Liquid Galaxy rigs" is a companion project for the 2013 End of Career project for the computing degree of Joan Llimiana, a University of Lleida Engineering School (EPS) alumni.

It consists in an Android aplication that will allow users of a Liquid Galaxy system
to handle several tasks from an android tablet.

The tools that the aplication will provide are divided in two main areas:

Public:

- Direct Navigation: allowing the users of the rig to navigate through the Google Earth contents with swipes, pinch in pinch out, a basic directional icon set, and a text search bar.

- Poi and tour Navigation: flying directly to defined points.

Private (with password acces)

- Poi and tour management: this section will handle the Point of Interest data, including capture from Google Earth, creation, editing, and deleting, both for POI and Tours.

- Basic administration tasks: this section will handle tasks like restarting the Liquid Galaxy system in various ways, or launching other demostrations and Html5 available aplications that runs over a Liquid Galaxy.

- Open Data link screen: this optional capability will be the link to the Open Data & Open Dai link to Liquid Galaxy main project, and will handle diversous related tasks.


This Android aplication will be a helpful add on for the project PULGA, eliminating the need for a Space Navigator 3d controller that can be expensive for schools, using instead Android tablets (even smartphones), available all around.

link.title: Proyecto LAB: Android controller and administration tool for Liquid Galaxy rigs.

entry.title: Proyecto LAB: Open Data & Open-Dai link to Liquid Galaxy
entry.content:
The "Open Data & Open Dai link to Liquid Galaxy" is the 2013 End of Career project for the computing degree of Joan Llimiana, a University of Lleida Engineering School (EPS) alumni.

It consists in a set of tools that will help the importing and visualization of the data from a public administration Open Data repository, all geolocated over Google Earth on a Liquid Galaxy rig.


Also the project will link with the Open-Dai European funded project that Ponent 2002 handles on behalf of the Lleida City Council.
Open-DAI  (Opening Data Architectures and Infrastructures of European Public Administrations) is a project with 11 partner of 4 European countries (Italy, Spain, Sweden and Turkey), working together to open a large part of Public Administrations databases to the wide audience of potential users through an open data hub in order to correlate data and to implement new digital public services
to evolve PA's information systems toward an open model and Service Oriented Architecture in order to overcome the monolithic and closed models and to facilitate software maintenance of existing silos to host PA's services into a scalable cloud infrastructure in order to meet the evolving needs

Innovation, business opportunities and digital services are the three goals that drive Open-DAI.


The "Open Data & Open Dai link to Liquid Galaxy" is possible thanks to the partnership with the Lleida City Council and his Computing Department.

link.title: Proyecto LAB: Open Data & Open-Dai link to Liquid Galaxy

entry.title: GSOC Google Summer of Code
entry.content:
El Google Summer of Code es un servicio de becas para el desarrollo de aplicaciones Open Source durante el verano de estudiantes universitarios.




El Liquid Galaxy LAB est integrado dentro del proyecto Liquid Galaxy, el cual pertenece al GSOC, junto a nuestros partners End Point y UWS.

Cada ao presentamos alumnos a las becas de Google. En los cursos 2013, 2014 y 2015 9 alumnos han sido becados con hasta 5.500$ y la posibilidad de visitar las instalaciones de Google en Mountain View, California, y otros lugares apasionantes:

entry.title: Instalaciones
entry.content:
El espacio del Liquid Galaxy LAB se ubica en el edificio CEDICO del Parque Cientfico, estando dotado con cinco sistemas Liquid Galaxy cedidos por diferentes partners, con 24 pantallas y cpus de ltima generacin.







Diferentes fotos con alumnos que han ido cursando sus proyectos de fin de grado, de mster, prcticas y doctorados.















Inauguracin de las instalaciones por las autoridades, encabezadas por el Alcalde de Lleida y Presidente del Parc Cientfic de Lleida, Sr. ngel Ros, y el Vicepresidente y Rector de la Universidad de Lleida, Sr. Roberto Fernndez







 Adems diponemos de acceso al Lleida Liquid Galaxy, el sistema que originalmente creamos para el Parque Cientfico y que fu la semilla de esta actuacin.

entry.title: Partners
entry.content: El Liquid Galaxy LAB cuenta con la colaboracin activa dentro de sus proyectos de diferentes instituciones y empresas:

entry.title: Matrcula para el proyecto de final de Grado de Marc Gonzalez con el Liquid Galaxy e Interactive Spaces
entry.content:
El 24 de septiembre el amigo Marc Gonzalez present su proyecto de final de grado.
Ha sido todo un placer mentorizarlo en su estancia en el Liquid Galaxy LAB, junto a Ismael Arroyo y Carlos de Dios en este curso ya acabado 2013-2014.



Con presencia de sus profesores y examinadores, Marc ha presentado su proyecto que estaba basado en la interaccin por voz a travs de Interactive Spaces con el Liquid Galaxy, todo un montaje de pelcula que adems prximamente tendr presentacin pblica.






Una vez realizada su presentacin nos hemos dirigido al Liquid Galaxy LAB para hacer una demostracin prctica del sistema:


Y ya solo felicitar a Marc Gonzalez, el cual ha recibido una matrcula de honor por su proyecto, aparte de la beca de 5.500$ de Google que le conseguimos a travs del Liquid Galaxy LAB junto a los compaeros de End Point Corp. y Western Sidney University. (thanks Ben, thanks Andrew)


Y aqu los slides de su presentacin.

entry.title: Presentacin Liquid Galaxy LAB
entry.content:
El Liquid Galaxy LAB es un laboratorio del Parque Cientfico de Lleida, Espaa. 
Su objetivos es desarrollar proyectos de investigacin relaciones con tecnologias GEO de Google, especialmente el Liquid Galaxy. El Laboratorio fu fundado en el 2010 por Andreu Ibaez, conocido evangelista Google en Espaa, y tiene como base el trabajo con aplicaciones de cdigo abierto y estudiantes universitarios.

El Liquid Galaxy LAB es adems una comunidad de antiguos estudiantes, mentores, profesores y desarrolladores, de Lleida, Espaa y el mundo entero.




Diferentes estudiantes pasan por el LAB cada ao, alrededor de 30, haciendo sus prcticas oficiales, proyectos de final de grado y mster y hasta doctorados. As mismo estudiantes de grados de formacin profesional cursan sus prcticas curriculares en nuestras instalaciones.


















Ms de un centenar de estudiantes han pasado por nuestras instalaciones, y otros 400 han trabajado remotamente en nuestros proyectos desde todo el mundo. 19 de ellos adems obtuvieron una beca Google Summer of Code.



Adems desde el pasado otoo del 2017, el laboratorio obtuvo la confianza de Google para trabajar su programa para estudiantes pre-universitarios Google Code-in, con el que ms de 300 estudiantes han trabajado durante 3 meses con nuestras plataformas, guiados por varias docenas de mentores.


Queremos dar las gracias a las compaas y organizaciones que nos dan su soporte:














 



El laboratorio dispone de 120 metros cuadrados situados en las oficinas centrales del parque, edificio CEDICO, donde disponemos de 7 sistemas Liquid Galaxy (algo nico en el mundo entero), incluyendo 30 pantallas y ordenadores de ltima generacin gracias a las donaciones de nuestros partners en hardware Gigabyte, Benq, Corsair y HP. 







Algunas fotos de los estudiantes locales o desplazados a trabajar en el LAB. Estudiantes de otros pases trabajan va videoconferencia. 













Inauguracin del laboratorio por el Alcalde Angel Ros, y el Rector de la Universidad de Lleida, Roberto Fernandez, entre otras personalidades.





Disponemos adems del Lleida Liquid Galaxy, un sistema de una tonelada de peso equipado con 7 pantallas de 55", el cual es visto por miles de visitantes al parque y a veces decenas de miles en las ferias a la que lo desplazamos.
